result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E VanHara

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2023 at 09:45 am.

9:03 AM Defendant John E VanHara in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for John E VanHara.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates she was recently assigned in one of the case files. Asks to be heard on bond today. Asking the court to consider a modification or a reduced cash bond of $100 in case 22CM1120. Defense makes statements on the record. Looking to resolve all these matters and is seeking a plea and sentencing date. 
State does not object to modifying the bond in case 22CM1120 to a signature bond. 
BTC: Cash bond is modified to $750 signature bond in case 22CM1120; same conditions. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for John E VanHara
Current: 3816 Contessa Ct, Sturtevant, WI 53177 United States  (Effective: 01-10-2022)
Prior: 1635 Lakewood Ave, Racine, WI 53403
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:30 AM Defendant John E VanHara in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he is seeking a bond reduction and states why. Seeking a small cash bond of $100. Has not met with Atty Moore face-to-face. 
State indicates there are victims in one of the case files ad cannot move forward with a bond hearing today. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.

2:18 PM Defendant John E VanHara appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for John E VanHara.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
